title: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk has been shot at an event at Utah Valley University, a spokesperson says
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Charlie Kirk was shot during an event at Utah Valley University, according to a spokesperson.
Police reported three fatalities in a shooting at a Target in Austin, Texas.
A suspect has been detained in connection with the Austin Target shooting.

title: Patriots’ defensive coordinator Terrell Williams will be away from team for a few days
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots defensive coordinator Terrell Williams is temporarily away from the team due to a recent health issue.
Coach Mike Vrabel announced Williams's absence, emphasizing it's unrelated to a past incident and tests are ongoing.
Inside linebackers coach Zak Kuhr may fill in, but Vrabel didn't confirm Sunday playcalling plans before Friday.

title: 8 unforgettable fall destinations in Vermont, according to Boston.com readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Franklin County offers scenic rail trails like the 93-mile Lamoille Valley Rail Trail and the 26.4-mile Missisquoi Valley Rail Trail.
Scenic Route 100 Byway provides a 146-mile scenic drive through fall foliage, passing through towns like Stowe and Waterbury.
Morgan in Vermont's Northeast Kingdom offers vibrant foliage around Seymour Lake, providing a picturesque and peaceful experience.

title: Readers: Are cider doughnuts ever bad?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Apple cider doughnuts are a popular fall treat in New England, praised for the perfect balance of taste and texture.
Alex Schwartz emphasizes the importance of fry texture and recommends against store-bought, boxed cider doughnuts.
Readers previously recommended Bolton Spring Farm, Carver Hill Orchard, and Smolak Farms for top cider doughnuts.

title: Review & setlist: Dua Lipa ramps up the energy, and the electricity, at TD Garden
author: Annie Jonas and Kelly Chan
bullets: Dua Lipa energized TD Garden in Boston on her 'Radical Optimism Tour,' debuting material from her 2024 album.
Lipa's set featured elaborate visuals and choreography, resonating with both pop ballads and upbeat tracks.
The concert included an Aerosmith cover, connecting with older fans, and Lipa's personal thanks to the audience.

title: How to buy World Cup tickets for Gillette Stadium
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Gillette Stadium in Foxborough will host seven matches for the 2026 World Cup between June 13 and July 9.
Ticket prices for the Boston games start at $60 and can reach up to $6,730, with a variable pricing strategy.
Fans can register for tickets via a FIFA ID, with the first sales phase running from September 10 through September 19.

title: Greg Olsen spoke about getting replaced by Tom Brady
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Greg Olsen expressed disappointment in media coverage after Tom Brady replaced him as Fox Sports lead commentator.
Olsen acknowledged his ego was affected but held no personal animosity towards Brady for taking his role.
Tom Brady's commentary performance in last year's Super Bowl faced scrutiny, with doubts about his broadcasting skills.

title: Boston police release photos in late-night cellphone thefts investigation
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police released photos of suspects involved in cellphone thefts outside nightclubs and bars in Fenway, Back Bay, and Seaport.
Suspects allegedly steal phones by offering unsolicited rides or threatening victims during or after rideshares late at night.
Stolen information is used for unauthorized credit card transactions and accessing accounts like Apple Pay, Venmo, and PayPal.

title: NBA passes new ‘heave’ rule that Payton Pritchard will love
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: NBA implements rule removing end-of-period heaves from player field-goal percentage, effective 2025-56 season.
A 'heave' is a shot taken beyond 36 feet within three seconds of the quarter's end.
Celtics' Payton Pritchard praised the new rule, saying it encourages players to take momentum-changing shots.

title: Watch Matt Damon and Ben Affleck in the first trailer for Netflix’s cop thriller ‘The Rip’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Matt Damon and Ben Affleck star as Miami cops in Netflix's thriller 'The Rip,' set to stream January 16.
The film follows officers discovering a large stash of cash, challenging team trust and drawing external threats.
Directed by Joe Carnahan, 'The Rip' also features Steven Yeun, Teyana Taylor, and Kyle Chandler among the cast.
